Comment: The engineering field is full of people who scrape by because they were halfway decent in math.   Just like doctors a couple generations ago, people motivated by money poured into the field despite lacking any fundamental talent or aptitude.   A lot of engineering professionals today are reasonably competent at basic analysis, but totally lacking in any synthesis skills. And the engineering disciplines have more than their fair share of sociopolitical imbeciles who think they are financial wizards simply because their retirement accounts are doing well.   Many are talentless hacks with poor understanding of anything outside of the degree field they were spoon-fed as part of their engineering program.  The result is that a huge portion are stuck in the bad part of the Dunning-Kruger curve when it comes to social, political and economic issues and even many technical fields that lack sufficient overlap with their degree program.  This effect is why we historically seen so many doctors who thought they were going to save the world when they got into politics. We will likely see a lot of the same from former engineers after so many poured into the field over the last couple decades.
